intro: Siphocampylus lecomtei, commonly known as the Lecomte's siphocampylus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southeastern Brazil. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
